escjava.translate
Class DefGCmd

java.lang.Object
  escjava.translate.DefGCmd

public class DefGCmd
extends java.lang.Object

Class DefGCmd implements the definedness guarded commands for JML assertion expressions. The functionality is invoked by adding the -idc option to escj. Supported functionality: - div and mod operators generate CHKARITHMETIC checks - Conditional&& and || operators generate ifcmd guarded commands. - Dereferrencing is partially supported. Still working on this. Usage: - DefGCmd defGCmd = new DefGCmd(); - defGCmd.trAndGen(expr); // expr is an untranslated expression. - GuardedCmd gc = defGCmd.popFromCode(); NOTE: This is work inprogress and its fairly experimental, so bear with us for the time being :). Use at your own risk.

Author:
George Karabotsos

public GuardedCmd popFromCode()
Convenient shorthand for the command in the return statement.

Returns:
a GuardedCmd value

trAndGen

public javafe.ast.Expr trAndGen(javafe.ast.Expr e)
This is the workhorse method. In this method we go through the Expr tree and generate the appropriate guarded commands. The guarded commands are generated and stored in the code field.

Parameters:
x - an Expr value
Returns:
an Expr value. This expression is always a Expr. its not set as GCExpr so that we do not get type mismatch between client methods.

reapAntecedent

public static javafe.ast.Expr reapAntecedent(javafe.ast.Expr post)
Expects a postcondition in the following form: A && P1 && ... && Pn ==> Q. It then extracts the antecedent, translates it into a GCExpr and returns it.

Parameters:
post - an Expr value
Returns:
an Expr value

reapConsequent

public static javafe.ast.Expr reapConsequent(javafe.ast.Expr post)
Expects a postcondition in the following form: A && P1 && ... && Pn ==> Q. It then extracts the consequent, and returns it.

Parameters:
post - an Expr value
Returns:
an Expr value

reapLeftmostConjunct

public static javafe.ast.Expr reapLeftmostConjunct(javafe.ast.Expr e)
Iterates through a tree of ASTNodes denoting number of conjunctions. It reaps the leftmost one and rebuilds the remaining ones.

Parameters:
e - an Expr value
Returns:
an Expr value

processPostcondition

public static void processPostcondition(int label,
                                        java.util.Map mapAnte2AntePost,
                                        javafe.ast.Expr pred)
This method will obtain a postcondition in the form of an implication, where the antecedent is the conjointed req. cl. exprs. along with some other predicates ESC adds. It will break it into its antecedent and consequent expressions. It will then call addConj2Map() and use the antecedent and the condition label to build a unique key so that the pair of antecedent, consequent is stored in the map.

Parameters:
label - an int value
mapAnte2AntePost - a Map value
pred - an Expr value

addConj2Map

public static void addConj2Map(int label,
                               java.util.Map mapAnte2AntePost,
                               javafe.ast.Expr ante,
                               javafe.ast.Expr post)
Uses the ante and label values to build a key where by it will store the ante expression along with the conjointed post values that have the same ante and the same label.

Parameters:
mapAnte2AntePost - a Map value
ante - an Expr value
post - an Expr value
